body_text: Mirai Nikki OVA is equal to the manga ending? Why does the anime conclude seconds before the manga concludes? The final scene where Yuno breaks into his world is crucial for the ending, yet they saved it for the OVA. Many people I know haven't seen the OVA, and missed this final embrace. I remember reading the final volume of the manga because the anime ending seemed inconclusive, until I realized the OVA had the final ending. Does anyone know why they did this?

How did Yuno become alive again? As we all know yuno died and yuki became god and became frustrated after that.
